column4: I saved most of Crimsun's messages. I hope I can get this shit compiled on my own
I did lose the URL to the ALSA 1.0.9 rc 2 pack though :(
IS THERE ANYONE ALIVE OUT THERE
k8 should be better than k7, yeah :)
You aren't smarter than gcc. Most people aren't.
But that has nothing to do with switching to 64-bit.
gcc figures out how to use the registers, the algorithm is written in C
I don't know if I've said this enough yet but AMD64 is just an x86 with 64-bit extensions. :)
It all comes down to gcc being smarter than you are producing machine code for the AMD64. :)
Let me know we you rewrite GNOME in asm
if you read what I said, you'd see only bits and pieces of things are ASM Now. Like a looped encoding function. Never a whole program.
The only time ASM is used is when you're doing embedded stuff.
I'm not lecturing you on anything
